That happens occasionally with take off for me. I have the problem that my aircraft love the water on a carrier take off in defiance of the elevators.

You have to tilt the nose up when your about to touch down to prevent that.
Also, make sure you deploy the flaps and that you are going sufficiently slow. Press F to deploy the flaps.

Most of my landing attempts are literally in the heat of combat. My plane gets all dinged up with the wings only a hit or two short of snapping, and I try to set it down in a nearby field rather than wreck it completely. So far I usually survive the landing, but what's left of the engine gets wrecked in the process.

I'm up to level 3 America, level 1 Germany though.

I've just done the singe mission- Eagle Day, solo. Having to face 29 He111 with a few AI partners in a Hurricane is quite a challenge but then I had to land with the damaged aircraft. The engine damage was on black but I thought that meant the engine was broken but it worked to get back across the channel and land.
Autorepair is optional? I was under the impression that the planes would be broken without it?

Nope,

with autorepair off your planes repair over time (low level planes repair fast, high level planes slowly - a couple of minutes up to a week for a high level bomber with kerbal crew).

This repair over time is free, autorepair costs money (a huge amount of money for high level planes). So if you alternate between nations you can save a lot. And higher lvl planes cost a lot.

You don't have to bother with it for tier 1-5 tough, the difference is very small (you can see your costs in the log). Stats like these are displayed when you mouse over your planes in the hangar. Reserve planes are always free to repair.
